title: The North Wind and the Sun
author: Aesop

content.text: Once upon a time, in a land where the sky stretched wide and the earth lay quiet beneath it, there lived two mighty forces of nature: the North Wind and the Sun.
Though they were both powerful in their own ways, they often disagreed about who was the stronger of the two.
One day, as they gazed down upon a traveler walking along a dusty road, the North Wind puffed out his chest and said, "See that man there, wrapped in his warm cloak?
I could make him remove it in an instant!
No one can resist my icy breath."  The Sun, glowing golden and gentle, smiled and replied, "Oh, I do not think so.
You may try, but I believe I can persuade him far more kindly."  The North Wind scoffed. "Kindness?
What use is kindness when strength is what truly matters?
Watch and learn, Sun."  With that, the North Wind gathered all his might and blew a fierce, howling gust toward the traveler.
The trees bent low, their leaves rustling wildly, and the dust swirled into the air.
The traveler shivered and pulled his cloak tighter around himself, holding it fast with both hands.
The North Wind blew even harder, his breath turning to sharp, biting cold.
The traveler’s teeth chattered, and he wrapped his cloak more snugly, refusing to let go.
No matter how hard the North Wind blew—whether in great bursts or steady, freezing streams—the man only clung to his cloak more tightly.
At last, the North Wind grew weary.
His breath came in exhausted gasps, and he admitted, "I cannot make him remove his cloak.
You may try now, Sun."  The Sun nodded and began to shine.
First, he sent a soft, warm light upon the traveler, like the gentle touch of a summer morning.
The man looked up, blinking in the golden glow, and felt the chill leave his bones.
The Sun shone a little brighter, and the air grew pleasantly warm.
The traveler loosened his cloak, letting it drape over his shoulders instead of clutching it so tightly.
Then, the Sun shone even more brightly, his rays dancing upon the traveler’s face.
The warmth spread like honey, sweet and soothing. The man smiled, feeling the last of the cold melt away.
Without thinking, he untied the cloak from his neck and let it fall open, enjoying the Sun’s kindness.
Finally, the Sun beamed down with all his strength, and the day grew so warm that the traveler could bear it no longer.
He stopped by the side of the road, removed his cloak entirely, and folded it neatly over his arm.
With a contented sigh, he continued on his way, grateful for the Sun’s gentle warmth.
The North Wind, watching from above, sighed in defeat. "You were right, Sun.

Kindness and warmth can achieve what force and cold cannot."  And so, the Sun and the North Wind learned an important lesson that day: true strength is not always about power, but about understanding and gentleness.
And from then on, they worked together in harmony, knowing that each had their own special way of caring for the world.
Now, close your eyes, little one, and feel the warmth of the Sun upon your face, just like the traveler did.
Let it lull you to sleep, safe and cozy, as the stars begin to twinkle in the night sky.
